text: Deborah Jeane Palfrey (March 18, 1956 â€“ May 1, 2008) was an American businesswoman and criminal. She was best known by the name she was given by the media, the D.C. Madam. Palfrey operated an escort agency, Pamela Martin and Associates, in Washington D.C.. She was convicted on April 15, 2008 of racketeering, using the mail for illegal purposes, and money laundering. Two weeks later, at age 52, she was found hanged in a garage. Autopsy results and the police said her death was a suicide. Palfrey was born in the Pittsburgh suburb of Charleroi, Pennsylvania. She grew up in Orlando, Florida. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Pittsburgh Category:Criminals from Pennsylvania Category:Criminals who committed suicide Category:Businesspeople from Orlando, Florida Category:Suicides by hanging in the United States
title: Deborah Jeane Palfrey
